intro: Anisochilus sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in Chinese medicine. The flowers bloom in summer and are often used in floral arrangements.
